posts.title: From 0 to 1 - Your First Kotlin APP
posts.text: Get startedNew a project, select Empty Activity, enter package name, select kotlin, enter the game name as Time Fighter, and try to run the app to show “hello world” on the screen. 1. Create new project : enter the name – Time Fighter, your package name 2. As default 3. Empty Activity 4. Press “run” arrow in the right-top corner 5. Wait and get the “hello world” Add UI2.1 Add TextView: your score2.2 Add TextView : time left2.3 Positioning Items (your score & time left)2.4 Adding a Constraint: tap me1. Open the activity_main.xml 2. Drag the Textview to the left corner and the right corner 3. Delete the “hello world” and drag the button to the center 4. Positioning each item to correctly shown 5. Fill in the elements for the three itemsTop-left: your score (Textview) enter id & textTop-right: left time (Textview) enter id & textCenter : TapMe (button) enter id & text Add string name in the string.xml 123Your Score: %1$d Time Left: %1$d Tap Me! then: 6. Run to see the UI Add Activity3.1 Adding Activity Properties3.2 Handling Actions1. Open the MyActivity.kt 2. Add Activity Properties internal lateinit var tapMeButton: Button internal lateinit var gameScoreTextView: TextView internal lateinit var timeLeftTextView: TextView AndtapMeButton = findViewById(R.id.tapMeButton)gameScoreTextView = findViewById(R.id.gameScoreTextView)timeLeftTextView = findViewById(R.id.timeLeftTextView) Like this: The “Button”,”Textview” are red, hold on “alt” and press”enter”, then choose import to solve the error one by one. It would be like this:Write function for “tapme”tapMeButton.setOnClickListener { view ->incrementScore()}And press “alt” and “enter” and choose “create a new function” to make the incrementScore() to be not red. Initialize the score as zero:internal var score = 0andFill in the new incrementScore function:private fun incrementScore() {score += 1val newScore = getString(R.string.yourScore, score)gameScoreTextView.text = newScore}It would be like this: 3.3 Display Starting ScoreAdd the starting score and display it by adding:// Show scoregameScoreTextView.text = getString(R.string.yourScore, score) 3.4 Adding a Countdown TimerAdd countdown timer definition(press alt and enter to import CountDownTimer)internal lateinit var countDownTimer: CountDownTimer internal val initialCountDown: Long = 60000 internal val countDownInterval: Long = 1000and resetGame funtion() definition(press alt and enter to create function)resetGame() Add resetGame funtion() valueprivate fun resetGame() {// Reset scorescore = 0// Show scoregameScoreTextView.text = getString(R.string.yourScore, score)// Show initial time leftval initialTimeLeft = initialCountDown / 1000timeLeftTextView.text = getString(R.string.timeLeft, initialTimeLeft)countDownTimer = object : CountDownTimer(initialCountDown, countDownInterval) {override fun onTick(millisUntilFinished: Long) {val timeLeft = millisUntilFinished / 1000timeLeftTextView.text = getString(R.string.timeLeft, timeLeft)}override fun onFinish() {// To Be Implemented Later}}gameStarted = false}It would be like: 3.5 Starting and Ending the Game Add string name in the strings.xml 1Times up! Your score was: %1$d Add gameStarted definition Add startGame in the incrementScore function if(!gameStarted){ startGame() } Define startGame(press alt+enter, create function)private fun startGame() { countDownTimer.start() gameStarted = true} Add endGame in the resetGame function -> onFinish() endGame() And endGame function(import the Toast by pressing alt+enter) private fun endGame() { Toast.makeText(this, getString(R.string.gameOverMessage, score), Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show() resetGame() } Run it to get:
